examples: His innovation came in his unexpected compositions, showing subjects off-center, from oblique angles, or closely cropped.
And as we move through our orbit, the whole thing is of course reversed, and the sun then reaches the northern hemisphere at a more oblique angle creating winter.
E-commerce also poses an oblique or indirect threat.
In the simulation, oblique collision angles gave more oblong, burrito-like shapes, creating moons like Prometheus.
words.defineEn: slanting or inclined in direction or course or position--neither parallel nor perpendicular nor right-angled
words.defineVi: nghiêng hoặc nghiêng theo hướng hoặc hướng hoặc vị trí - không song song cũng không vuông góc cũng không vuông góc

examples: During their lifetimes, these objects were likely obliterated through one or many collisions.
Secondly, in further good news, I am not totally obliterated.
We also know that activity from comets has obliterated a bunch of moons.
So I say, I am completely OBLITERATED.
They are the world's deadliest weapons, able to fly thousands of miles in 30 minutes and obliterate entire cities.
words.defineEn: remove completely from recognition or memory
words.defineVi: xóa hoàn toàn khỏi sự công nhận hoặc bộ nhớ

examples: Sanctions have failed to loosen his grip on power.
We have sanctioned individual Communist Party members.
You mentioned the sanctions.
But not all norm violations are informally sanctioned.
It probably introduces similar sanctions.
words.defineEn: an official or decree or statement granting permission or approval
words.defineVi: một quan chức hoặc nghị định hoặc tuyên bố cấp phép hoặc phê duyệt

words.defineEn: attempting to showcase how one believes to be morally or religiously superior
words.defineVi: cố gắng thể hiện cách một người tin là vượt trội về mặt đạo đức hoặc tôn giáo

examples: And at that point, you start to have real discussions about the sanctity of the US dollar reserve currency status.
And at that point, you start to have real discussions about the sanctity of the US dollar reserve currency status.
We believe that the Ukrainian government, whatever kind of government it is, has the right to the sanctity of its borders.
If you say that life is just always, inherently, good, then you’re said to place a high value on the sanctity of life.
It really spoke to the leadership of Chief Arradondo, how he takes seriously the notion of good policing and upholding the sanctity of life as the highest ideal for policing.
words.defineEn: the quality of being holy
words.defineVi: phẩm chất của sự thánh thiện

words.defineEn: deliberately not having one obvious meaning and therefore open to interpretation, often intended to deceive
words.defineVi: cố tình không có một ý nghĩa rõ ràng và do đó dễ giải thích, thường nhằm mục đích đánh lừa

words.defineEn: to purposely speak in a way that is confusing and open to different interpretations, aiming to deceive others
words.defineVi: cố tình nói một cách khó hiểu và mở ra nhiều cách hiểu khác nhau, nhằm mục đích lừa dối người khác

examples: Face mites, for example, are pretty innocuous.
It seems like an innocuous critter, named for the frothy foam it leaves behind.
People tend to more readily comply with a big request after they've first agreed to smaller more innocuous requests.
We have this medium that was fashioned for just casual, innocuous sharing of thoughts and pictures among friends suddenly being used for political speech.

We're looking at these election polls and what went wrong with the election polls, but I've been kind of beating this drum for the past four years and pointing out situations where we ask what seems to be innocuous questions about life in general, such as do you plan to take a vacation this year where we're suddenly getting these huge partisan splits on a question that never had anything to do with partisanship.
words.defineEn: not injurious to physical or mental health
words.defineVi: không gây tổn hại cho sức khỏe thể chất hoặc tinh thần

examples: She wrote, "When one reads of a witch being ducked, of a woman possessed by devils, of a wise woman selling herbs, or even a very remarkable man who had a mother, then I think we're on the track of a lost novelist, a suppressed poet, of some mute and inglorious Jane Austen."
words.defineEn: (used of conduct or character) deserving or bringing disgrace or shame
words.defineVi: (được sử dụng cho hành vi hoặc tính cách) xứng đáng hoặc mang lại sự ô nhục hoặc xấu hổ

examples: The infidels are our enemy until the day of judgment.
They were yelling, "Kill the infidels."
They were yelling: "Kill the infidels."
They were yelling, "Kill the infidels."
They were yelling: "Kill the infidels."
words.defineEn: a person who does not acknowledge your god
words.defineVi: một người không thừa nhận thần của bạn

examples: What is stressed rather is that the same phenomenon provides the foundation for both historical tendencies.
Nevertheless, the phenomenon continued.
Industry experts call this phenomenon pet humanization.
Also, this phenomenon can most likely explain the asteroid’s weird shape.
This phenomenon is one of the mind's great mysteries.
words.defineEn: an observable fact or event that is perceived through the senses
words.defineVi: một thực tế hoặc sự kiện có thể quan sát được nhận thức thông qua các giác quan

examples: The sector is growing at a phenomenal rate.
This movie is absolutely phenomenal.
The display looks absolutely phenomenal.
Business is phenomenal for them right now.
He's phenomenal.
words.defineEn: related to a remarkable or exceptional occurrence that is observed or experienced
words.defineVi: liên quan đến một sự kiện đáng chú ý hoặc đặc biệt được quan sát hoặc trải nghiệm

examples: So it wasn’t simply idiosyncrasies on the president’s part.
words.defineEn: an unusual or strange behavior, thought, or habit that is specific to one person
words.defineVi: một hành vi, suy nghĩ hoặc thói quen bất thường hoặc kỳ lạ dành riêng cho một người

examples: The friends would sometimes revert to playground idiom.
My friend tried explaining a few French idioms to me, but I'm afraid they were lost in translation.
And nothing was so irritating as the confident way he used archaic idiom.
from now on, i need you to give me original examples with different verb conjugations for every idiom that i give u, please use imaginary names in your examples
Anger and shouting simply aren’t a part of his idiom.
words.defineEn: a manner of speaking or writing that is characteristic of a particular person, group, or era, and that involves the use of particular words, phrases, or expressions in a distinctive way
words.defineVi: một cách nói hoặc viết đặc trưng của một người, nhóm hoặc thời đại cụ thể và liên quan đến việc sử dụng các từ, cụm từ hoặc cách diễn đạt cụ thể theo một cách đặc biệt

words.defineEn: capable of being made imperfect
words.defineVi: có khả năng được thực hiện không hoàn hảo

examples: Less than a decade after his dissertation, newspapers were falsely insisting that experiments could prove sweetness was imperceptible on the back of the tongue.
words.defineEn: impossible or difficult to perceive by the mind or senses
words.defineVi: không thể hoặc khó nhận thức bằng tâm trí hoặc giác quan

examples: Louisa's face was impassive.
But my torso would remain perfectly still and my face would remain impassive, expressionless.
He had begun to think that he'd like it if the pretty but impassive face, which changed so beautifully for the sullen young brother, could change for him, too.
words.defineEn: deliberately impassive in manner
words.defineVi: cố ý thản nhiên theo cách

examples: They paid for his impatience.
And I understand the impatience.
This impatience means that men are 25% more likely to lose money on their investments.
Psychologists and other researchers have discovered three big ways our instant nuggets and dollar tacos are intensifying our impatience.
You can also have impatience or trouble regulating your emotions and also act without thinking.
words.defineEn: a lack of patience; irritation with anything that causes delay
words.defineVi: thiếu kiên nhẫn; khó chịu với bất cứ điều gì gây ra sự chậm trễ

words.defineEn: beyond reasonable limits
words.defineVi: vượt quá giới hạn hợp lý

words.defineEn: imperceptible to the senses or the mind
words.defineVi: không thể nhận thấy bằng các giác quan hoặc tâm trí
